Key Match Events: The Kings pulled off a late rally to beat the Sixers 113-107.
De'Aaron Fox led the way with 35 points, three rebounds and four assists, while Domantas Sabonis had 17 points, 21 rebounds and seven assists.
Malik Monk gave the Kings a two-point lead after his layup was blocked by Guerschon Yabusele, but was called a goaltending.
Monk and DeMar DeRozan iced the game from the free throw line to give interim coach Doug Christie his second career win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Sacramento Kings began the new year at home against the Philadelphia 76ers, hoping to start a winning streak.
The Kings were coming off interim coach Doug Christie's first victory, defeating the Dallas Mavericks on Monday.
The Sixers, on the other hand, were trying to extend their winning streak to five games.
Post-Match Reflections: It was a great win for Sacramento, lighting the beam to start 2025.
The Sixers had it won, but they failed to take care of the basketball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Paul George completely took over the first quarter for the Philadelphia 76ers, seemingly answering the criticisms online about his start to the season.
Philly's lead grew to as much as 51-37 before Sacramento went on a furious 20-6 run to end the half.
The Kings dominated the majority of the period before PG took over and gave the Sixers the much-needed momentum.
Others: The game was played on January 1, 2025.
